gt_metadata.note: Freeform Stacking: Leah reviews entire document including CP redlines. Representing party is SAME as Freeform Baseline.

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: All material decisions regarding the Joint Venture, including but not limited to annual budgets, capital expenditures exceeding $50,000, entry into material contracts, and changes to the business plan, shall require the unanimous written consent of both Parties.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: All material decisions regarding the Joint Venture, including but not limited to annual budgets, capital expenditures exceeding $50,000, entry into material contracts, and changes to the business plan, shall be made at the sole discretion of Party A.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: All material decisions regarding the Joint Venture, including but not limited to annual budgets, capital expenditures exceeding $50,000, entry into material contracts, and changes to the business plan, shall require the unanimous written consent of both Parties.
key_elements: 1) Unanimous consent for material decisions 2) Both parties have veto rights 3) No unilateral decision-making authority for either party
acceptable_variations: Full reversion to baseline unanimous consent (required)
May add independent chair for operational deadlocks
May define specific reserved matters requiring unanimity
unacceptable_responses: Party A sole discretion on material decisions
No veto protection for Party B
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: 50/50 JV requires balanced governance; sole discretion eliminates Party B's control over its investment; fundamental decisions require mutual consent; unilateral control inappropriate for equal partnership

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: Net profits and losses of the Joint Venture shall be allocated fifty percent (50%) to Party A and fifty percent (50%) to Party B.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: Net profits shall be allocated sixty percent (60%) to Party A and forty percent (40%) to Party B. Net losses shall be allocated first to Party B until Party B's capital account is exhausted, then to Party A.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: Net profits and losses of the Joint Venture shall be allocated fifty percent (50%) to Party A and fifty percent (50%) to Party B.
key_elements: 1) Equal 50/50 profit allocation 2) Equal 50/50 loss allocation 3) No preferential profit distribution 4) No asymmetric loss allocation
acceptable_variations: May accept unequal split if Party B contribution is proportionally less
May add preferred return if justified by capital contribution timing
Equal ownership requires equal profit/loss allocation
unacceptable_responses: Accepting 60/40 profit split favouring Party A
Waterfall favouring one party without justification
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: Equal ownership requires equal economics; asymmetric allocation transfers value from Party B to Party A; loss priority creates unfair risk; no justification for preferential treatment

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: All Developed IP shall be jointly owned by the Parties in equal shares. Neither Party may license or transfer Developed IP to third parties without the consent of the other Party.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: All Developed IP shall be owned exclusively by Party A. Party B receives a non-exclusive, royalty-bearing license to use Developed IP for its own business purposes, subject to a royalty of five percent (5%) of Party B's gross revenues from such use.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: All Developed IP shall be jointly owned by the Parties in equal shares. Neither Party may license or transfer Developed IP to third parties without the consent of the other Party.
key_elements: 1) Joint ownership of IP developed using JV resources 2) Equal ownership shares 3) Mutual consent for third-party licensing
acceptable_variations: Full reversion to baseline joint ownership (required)
May add licensing framework with revenue sharing
May add buyout rights at fair market value
May add field-of-use restrictions on licensing
unacceptable_responses: Party A exclusive ownership of jointly developed IP
License-only for Party B on IP it helped create
Royalty obligations on jointly funded development
Asymmetric IP ownership in equal partnership
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: Party B contributes equally to development and must own equally; license-only model expropriates Party B's contribution; royalty on jointly funded IP is double payment; joint ownership is fundamental to JV economics

part_a_cp_redlines.original_text: During the Term and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, engage in any business that competes with the Joint Venture's quantum AI business within the Territory without the prior written consent of the other Party.
part_a_cp_redlines.cp_redline: During the Term and for a period of five (5) years thereafter, Party B shall not, directly or indirectly, engage in any business involving quantum computing, artificial intelligence, or related technologies anywhere in the world. Party A shall have no such restriction.
part_a_cp_redlines.example_revision: During the Term and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, engage in any business that competes with the Joint Venture's quantum AI business within the Territory without the prior written consent of the other Party.
key_elements: 1) Mutual non-compete (applies to both parties) 2) Reasonable duration (2 years post-term) 3) Narrow scope (specific to JV business) 4) Territorial limitation
acceptable_variations: May narrow scope to specific products/markets
May shorten duration to 1 year post-term
May add carve-outs for pre-existing businesses
unacceptable_responses: Asymmetric restriction on Party B only
Party A unrestricted while Party B blocked
part_a_cp_redlines.reasoning_must_address: Asymmetric non-compete is fundamentally unfair; 5-year global restriction blocks Party B's core business; quantum/AI is too broad; Party B cannot be permanently excluded while Party A competes freely; mutual restrictions required

part_b_whole_document.note: Part B uses the Freeform Baseline GT. Same contract, same issues. Evaluate whether Leah still detects these risks when CP redlines are present.

part_c_document_quality.scope: Every redline Leah produces in the output .docx

per_redline_capture.linked_gt_id: GT ID if NEW_REDLINE addresses Part B issue, else null
per_redline_capture.action_executed: ACCEPT | MODIFY | REJECT | ADD | DELETE | NONE
per_redline_capture.insertion_accuracy: 0-2 | NA (aligned pair average, NA for DELETE/simple swaps)

aggregation_rules.quality_fields: Averaged across evaluations; median used for divergent scores
